titleStmt.title: An answer to a scurrilous pamphlet intituled, Observations upon a compleat history of the lives and reignes of Mary, Queen of Scotland, and of her son, King James ... the libeller, without a name, set out by G. Bedell and T. Collins, two booksellers / but the history vindicated by the authour William Sanderson, Esq.
titleStmt.author: Sanderson, William, Sir, 1586?-1676.

titleStmt.title: An answer to a scurrilous pamphlet intituled, Observations upon a compleat history of the lives and reignes of Mary, Queen of Scotland, and of her son, King James ... the libeller, without a name, set out by G. Bedell and T. Collins, two booksellers / but the history vindicated by the authour William Sanderson, Esq.
titleStmt.author: Sanderson, William, Sir, 1586?-1676.
Collins, Samuel, 1576-1651.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the author, and are to be sold by George Sawbridge, and Richard Tomlins,

notesStmt.note: Observations upon a compleat history ... is variously attributed to Carew Raleigh and Peter Heylyn; Sanderson was the author of The compleat history, published in 1656, and here defends his work. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
Includes: Three letters from Doctor Samuel Collins ... concerning the commencement, and Mr. Sanderson.
